thread.title: NEEDLES: Minnesota man arrested on suspicion of possessing stolen property
thread.title_full: NEEDLES: Minnesota man arrested on suspicion of possessing stolen property - Press Enterprise

author: ANNE MILLERBERND
title: NEEDLES: Minnesota man arrested on suspicion of possessing stolen property
text:
By ANNE MILLERBERND / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 26, 2015 Updated: 11:02 a.m. NEEDLES: Minnesota man arrested on suspicion of possessing stolen property Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Related article Â» Far from home, a Minnesota man was arrested Sunday evening, Oct. 25, in Needles on suspicion of possession of stolen property after authorities say he failed to yield in a stolen vehicle.
A San Bernardino County sheriff's deputy responded to a reported theft at McDonald's at 8:03 p.m. and was given a description of the suspect and the vehicle he was driving.
The deputy found the vehicle at a business on the 2400 block of Needles Highway. A records check revealed that it was stolen out of Texas.
Deputies tried to stop the vehicle once it entered Interstate 40, but trailed the vehicle about nine miles down the road from East Broadway Street to Park Moabi Road, where a spike strip stopped the vehicle.
Deputies arrested 43-year-old Orlando Rice, of Rochester, Minn., and took him to West Valley Detention Center. Bail was set at $50,000.
Authorities ask anyone with information about the incident to contact the Needles Sheriff's Station at 760-326-9200.
